Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee.

programme.title: Urban Legend (1998)
programme.desc: A student investigates when a spate of killings at a New England college draws parallels with local myths. As the murderer brutally dispatches her friends one by one, she faces a race against time to discover the identity of the killer before she becomes the next victim. Horror, starring Alicia Witt, Rebecca Gayheart, Jared Leto and Michael Rosenbaum.

programme.title: Repo! The Genetic Opera (2008)
programme.desc: In a world that has been ravaged by a viral epidemic, a corporation offers to help people preserve their health by selling organ transplants. The seemingly benevolent company even provides its customers with a payment plan - but if the money isn't there on time, grisly repossessions are carried out. Musical horror comedy, starring Alexa Vega, Anthony Head and Paul Sorvino.

programme.title: Attack the Block (2011)
programme.desc: A student nurse living in a south London tower block escapes a dangerous encounter with a teenage gang when aliens invade. As the creatures cause mayhem throughout the estate, she joins forces with her would-be attackers to fight off the extraterrestrial forces. Sci-fi comedy thriller, with Jodie Whittaker, John Boyega and Nick Frost.

A group of astronauts on a decade-long mission aboard a space station fight for survival when a catastrophic event on Earth leads to human extinction. Writer/director John Suits' sci-fi thriller, starring Omar Epps, Kate Walsh and Angus Macfadyen.

programme.title: Green Lantern (2011)
programme.desc: A cocky test pilot is given a mysterious ring by a dying alien and transported to another world, where he learns he has been recruited into a galactic peacekeeping organisation. He trains to use the incredible powers the ring grants him, and returns to Earth to defend it from a powerful force that feeds on fear. Sci-fi adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Peter Sarsgaard and Mark Strong.

programme.title: V for Vendetta (2005)
programme.desc: In the totalitarian Britain of the future, a masked anarchist sets out to undermine the rule of the fascist government and exact revenge on his old enemies, finding an unlikely ally in a woman he rescues from the secret police. A detective is assigned to track down the enigmatic fugitive - but begins to question his own motives. Action thriller, adapted by the creators of The Matrix from Alan Moore and David Lloyd's graphic novel. Starring Natalie Portman, Hugo Weaving, Stephen Rea and Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Death of Me (2020)
programme.desc: Holidaying on an island off the coast of Thailand, couple Neil and Christine awake hungover and with no memory of the previous night. They find footage on Neil's camera and watch - horrified - as Neil appears to murder Christine. With 24 hours until the next ferry and a typhoon threatening the island, Christine and Neil attempt to reconstruct the night's events. Horror, starring Maggie Q and Luke Hemsworth.

programme.title: Gothika (2003)
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husband's murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill.

programme.title: Body Cam (2020)
programme.desc: When a routine traffic stop results in the unexplained death of her colleague, cop Renee Lomito-Smith realises footage of the incident will play for her eyes only. As the attacks mount, she attempts to understand the supernatural force behind them. Director Malik Vitthal's horror, starring Mary J Blige, Nat Wolff and Anika Noni Rose.

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer (1997)
programme.desc: Four teenagers accidentally run over a stranger and hide the body rather than inform the authorities, only to find themselves stalked the following year by a shadowy figure who takes great delight in disposing of them in a variety of gruesome ways. Horror, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr and Anne Heche.

programme.title: Green Lantern (2011)
programme.desc: A cocky test pilot is given a mysterious ring by a dying alien and transported to another world, where he learns he has been recruited into a galactic peacekeeping organisation. He trains to use the incredible powers the ring grants him, and returns to Earth to defend it from a powerful force that feeds on fear. Sci-fi adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Peter Sarsgaard and Mark Strong.

A detective is assigned to track down the enigmatic fugitive - but begins to question his own motives. Action thriller, adapted by the creators of The Matrix from Alan Moore and David Lloyd's graphic novel. Starring Natalie Portman, Hugo Weaving, Stephen Rea and Stephen Fry.

programme.title: You Should Have Left (2020)
programme.desc: A former banker, his actress wife and their spirited daughter book a holiday at an isolated modern home in the Welsh countryside where nothing is quite as it seems. Writer/director David Koepp's psychological thriller based on the novel by Daniel Kehlmann, starring Amanda Seyfried, Kevin Bacon and Avery Tiiu Essex.

programme.title: Come to Daddy (2019)
programme.desc: A privileged man in his thirties travels to a remote cabin in Oregon to reconnect with his estranged father, but events take a strange turn. Comedy thriller, starring Elijah Wood and Stephen McHattie, with Michael Smiley, Madeleine Sami and Martin Donovan.

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer (1997)
programme.desc: Four teenagers accidentally run over a stranger and hide the body rather than inform the authorities, only to find themselves stalked the following year by a shadowy figure who takes great delight in disposing of them in a variety of gruesome ways. Horror, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr and Anne Heche.

Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill.

As the attacks mount, she attempts to understand the supernatural force behind them. Director Malik Vitthal's horror, starring Mary J Blige, Nat Wolff and Anika Noni Rose.

programme.title: Body Cam (2020)
programme.desc: When a routine traffic stop results in the unexplained death of her colleague, cop Renee Lomito-Smith realises footage of the incident will play for her eyes only. As the attacks mount, she attempts to understand the supernatural force behind them. Director Malik Vitthal's horror, starring Mary J Blige, Nat Wolff and Anika Noni Rose.

programme.title: Outlander (2008)
programme.desc: An alien crash-lands in eighth-century Norway and discovers the deadly creature he was transporting has escaped and decimated a village. He joins forces with a local Viking tribe and they set out in pursuit of the ferocious beast before it can cause further bloodshed. Sci-fi adventure, starring James Caviezel, Sophia Myles, Jack Huston and John Hurt.

programme.title: The New Mutants (2020)
programme.desc: After a near-death experience during a strange tornado, Danielle Moonstar awakens in an abandoned research facility run by the mysterious Dr Cecilia Reyes. There, Dr Reyes introduces Dani to four other equally uncommon teenagers - Illyana Rasputin, Rahne Sinclair, Sam Guthrie, and Roberto da Costa. Reyes wants to keep them safe and sound until they learn how to be in full control of their extraordinary abilities. Before long, however, they all start to experience horrifying hallucinations. Superhero adventure, the final instalment in the X-Men film series, starring Maisie Williams and Anya Taylor-Joy.

programme.title: Mortal (2020)
programme.desc: Eric, a young American-Norwegian, takes refuge in a forest after causing a fire that killed several people. Arrested by the police, he meets a psychologist, Christine, and they soon discover Eric has supernatural powers which he cannot control. Writer/director Andre Ovredal's fantasy drama, starring Nat Wolff, Priyanka Bose and Iben Akerlie. In Norwegian with subtitles.

programme.title: Marabunta (1998)
programme.desc: A group of terrified residents trapped in their evacuated town face a desperate struggle for survival as hordes of flesh-eating ants descend on them in search of a quick snack. Action thriller, starring Eric Lutes, Julia Campbell, Mitch Pileggi and Jeremy Foley.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in London (1981)
programme.desc: A tourist is attacked while walking on the Yorkshire Moors and undergoes a terrifying metamorphosis, becoming a ravening werewolf whenever the moon is full. John Landis's horror comedy, starring David Naughton, Griffin Dunne and Jenny Agutter, with appearances by Brian Glover and Rik Mayall as unwelcoming locals in an isolated pub. Featuring special effects by Rick Baker.

credits.actor: Rik Mayall as unwelcoming locals in an isolated pub

programme.title: Tremors: Shrieker Island (2020)
programme.desc: When a nature reserve in the Solomon Islands is infiltrated by Graboids and Shriekers, two leading scientists recruit Burt Gummer, monster hunter extraordinaire, to eradicate the infestation. While there, Burt picks up a potential new protege and encounters lost love. Action comedy, starring Michael Gross and Jon Heder.

programme.title: Outlander (2008)
programme.desc: An alien crash-lands in eighth-century Norway and discovers the deadly creature he was transporting has escaped and decimated a village. He joins forces with a local Viking tribe and they set out in pursuit of the ferocious beast before it can cause further bloodshed. Sci-fi adventure, starring James Caviezel, Sophia Myles, Jack Huston and John Hurt.

Superhero adventure, the final instalment in the X-Men film series, starring Maisie Williams and Anya Taylor-Joy.

programme.title: Godzilla (2014)
programme.desc: A conspiracy theorist's investigation of his wife's death in a nuclear reactor meltdown leads him and his soldier son into an encounter with underground creatures, which go on a deadly rampage across the world. The only hope for the human race may lie with another equally destructive giant monster. Thriller remake, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Bryan Cranston and Ken Watanabe.

programme.title: The Devil's Rejects (2005)
programme.desc: The evil Firefly family is tracked down by a crack squad of Texas Rangers, but in the ensuing battle three of the murderous clan escape and embark on a gory road trip. As the body count rises, an obsessed sheriff hires two unsavoury bounty hunters in a final bid to stop the blood-soaked crime spree. Horror, made as a sequel to House of 1000 Corpses, starring Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, William Forsythe, Michael Berryman and Ken Foree.

programme.title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold (2019)
programme.desc: Having spent most of her life exploring the jungle with her parents, nothing could prepare Dora for her most dangerous adventure ever - high school. Always the explorer, Dora quickly finds herself leading Boots (her best friend, a monkey), Diego, a mysterious jungle inhabitant and a rag tag group of teens on a live-action adventure to save her parents and solve the impossible mystery behind a lost city of gold. Live-action adaptation of the hit animated kids' show, starring Isabela Moner, Eva Longoria and Jeff Wahlberg.

programme.title: Pinocchio (2019)
programme.desc: Old woodcarver Geppetto's puppet creation, Pinocchio, magically comes to life with dreams of becoming a real boy. Easily led astray, Pinocchio tumbles from one misadventure to another as he is tricked, kidnapped and chased by bandits. Matteo Garrone's adaptation of the classic tale, starring Federico Ielapi and Roberto Benigni. In Italian.

programme.title: Adventures of Rufus: The Fantastic Pet (2020)
programme.desc: Friends Scott and Emily are at Scott's grandmother's home when they discover a mysterious creature and a wizard in a secret room. With the help of an ancient spell book, they'll gather some ingredients to make a magic dust to save their magical world. Adventure, starring Kyler Charles Beck, Cory Phillips and Leah NH Philpott.

programme.title: Adventures of Rufus: The Fantastic Pet (2020)
programme.desc: Friends Scott and Emily are at Scott's grandmother's home when they discover a mysterious creature and a wizard in a secret room. With the help of an ancient spell book, they'll gather some ingredients to make a magic dust to save their magical world. Adventure, starring Kyler Charles Beck, Cory Phillips and Leah NH Philpott.

programme.title: Robo-Dog (2015)
programme.desc: A youngster is devastated when his dog dies, so his inventor father comes up with a plan to replace the lost pet. He creates a talking canine robot, with all manner of useful gadgets built into his body. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Michael Campion and Olivia d'Abo, with the voice of James Arnold Taylor.

credits.actor: the voice of James Arnold Taylor

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. While the Browns try to clear Paddington's name, he tries to make himself at home in prison, winning over the other convicts and getting involved in an escape attempt. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington.

credits.actor: Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington

programme.title: The Witches (2020)
programme.desc: In 1967, an orphaned boy goes to live with his grandmother, only to find himself the prey of diabolical witches disguised as glamorous women. Heading to a seaside hotel seems like a great way to escape, but in an unfortunate twist of fate, the world's Grand High Witch is gathering her coven at the same resort, and has a nefarious plan in store. Co-writer/director Robert Zemeckis's take on the beloved Roald Dahl fantasy, starring Anne Hathaway, Octavia Spencer, Stanley Tucci, and narrated by Chris Rock.

programme.title: The Borrowers (1997)
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owner's son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Children's fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal (1982)
programme.desc: A survivor of a near-extinct race is given a dangerous quest as his world approaches an astronomical event that will decide its future. He must find a way to restore a broken piece to a magical crystal, which has become a source of dark power for the cruel creatures who wiped out his people. Jim Henson's puppet fantasy, with the voices of Stephen Garlick and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington.

Children's fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton.

programme.title: The Adventure Of A.R.I.: My Robot Friend (2020)
programme.desc: After repairing a broken robot, a teenager must help his new friend escape the clutches of a ruthless corporation who wants to turn the machine into a weapon. Director Stephen Shimek's family adventure, starring Jude Manley, Sophia Alongi and Greg Lutz.

programme.desc: After repairing a broken robot, a teenager must help his new friend escape the clutches of a ruthless corporation who wants to turn the machine into a weapon. Director Stephen Shimek's family adventure, starring Jude Manley, Sophia Alongi and Greg Lutz.

programme.title: Four Kids and It (2020)
programme.desc: A group of children on holiday in Cornwall meet a magical creature on the beach with the power to grant wishes. Family fantasy based on Jacqueline Wilson's novel, starring Matthew Goode, Paula Patton, Michael Caine and Russell Brand.

programme.title: The Big Wish (2019)
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old orphan Salma and her two foster brothers discover a special book that is filled with stories. They set off on an adventure to find the missing links to her family's heritage, in the hope of finally getting to meet Salma's long-lost parents. Animation, with the voices of Fernanda Castillo, Dino Andrade and Alan Estrada.

programme.title: Stardust (2007)
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star in question is in fact a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen.

programme.title: Cats (2019)
programme.desc: A tribe of cats called the Jellicles must decide annually which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new life. Co-writer and director Tom Hooper's adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit 1981 musical, featuring classic tracks Memory and Mr Mistoffelees. Starring Judi Dench, James Corden, Idris Elba and Rebel Wilson.

programme.title: Swimming for Gold (2020)
programme.desc: Claire Carpenter's dad sends her to Australia to coach an elite boys swim team. She finds herself face to face with long-time rival Mikayla Michaels, and the news that the camp will close if the team loses the next meet. To save the establishment, Claire must overcome her demons, set aside her differences with Mikayla, and rediscover her passion. Drama, starring Peyton List, Lauren Esposito and Daniel Needs.

programme.title: Four Kids and It (2020)
programme.desc: A group of children on holiday in Cornwall meet a magical creature on the beach with the power to grant wishes. Family fantasy based on Jacqueline Wilson's novel, starring Matthew Goode, Paula Patton, Michael Caine and Russell Brand.

Co-writer and director Tom Hooper's adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit 1981 musical, featuring classic tracks Memory and Mr Mistoffelees. Starring Judi Dench, James Corden, Idris Elba and Rebel Wilson.

programme.title: My Friend The Dolphin (2019)
programme.desc: A year after befriending a couple of kids in Florida, Bernie, a lovable dolphin returns and his young friends are thrilled. However, their old enemy Winston Mills has been released from prison and he's out for revenge. Can they save the day again? Director Kirk Harris's family adventure, starring Lola Sultan, Patrick Muldoon and Logan Allen.

programme.title: Strike (2018)
programme.desc: A young and ambitious mole wants to become a footballer and save his town's gold mine from greedy super villain The Boss. Director Trevor Hardy's animated adventure, featuring the voices of Ken Stott, Lizzie Waterworth and Alex Kelly.

credits.director: featuring the voices of Ken Stott

programme.title: The Big Wish (2019)

programme.title: Four Kids and It (2020)
programme.desc: A group of children on holiday in Cornwall meet a magical creature on the beach with the power to grant wishes. Family fantasy based on Jacqueline Wilson's novel, starring Matthew Goode, Paula Patton, Michael Caine and Russell Brand.

programme.title: Look Who's Talking (1989)
programme.desc: Pregnant Mollie is dumped by her boyfriend, and sets out after the baby's birth to find a surrogate father for her infant son Mikey, who comments on proceedings through a wisecracking inner monologue. Mikey is confident the cab driver who helped deliver him is the perfect man for the job - but his mother is less than convinced. Comedy, with John Travolta, Kirstie Alley and the voice of Bruce Willis.

programme.title: Look Who's Talking Too (1990)
programme.desc: Wisecracking toddler Mikey is joined by mischievous baby sister Julie and sibling rivalry inevitably erupts - while their parents have problems of their own to deal with, in the shape of the kids' good-for-nothing uncle. Comedy sequel, starring John Travolta and Kirstie Alley, with the voices of Bruce Willis and Rosanne Barr.

programme.title: Look Who's Talking Now (1993)
programme.desc: A family takes in two pet dogs, a scruffy mongrel with discipline problems and a prim and proper pedigree poodle, whose personality clashes create all sorts of mayhem for the household. Comedy sequel, starring John Travolta and Kirstie Alley, plus the voices of Diane Keaton and Danny DeVito as the canine duo.

credits.actor: plus the voices of Diane Keaton
Danny DeVito as the canine duo

programme.title: Paper Planes (2014)
programme.desc: An Australian boy struggling to cope with conflicts in his family develops a passion for flight after a teacher helps him make a paper plane. His enthusiasm takes him all the way to Tokyo, where he competes in the world paper plane championships, a journey that helps him make new friends and reconnect with his father. Family drama, starring Ed Oxenbould, Sam Worthington and David Wenham.

programme.title: Adventures in Zambezia (2012)
programme.desc: A falcon flies the nest to seek his fortune in a city for birds on the edge of Victoria Falls. His flying skills soon make a good impression on the locals, and he ends up defending the avian metropolis from attack by scavenging marabou storks, whom he learns have kidnapped his father. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jeremy Suarez, Abigail Breslin and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: The Cat in the Hat (2003)
programme.desc: Two bored youngsters are led on a series of zany misadventures when a manic moggy comes knocking at their door with a magical stovepipe hat on his head and mischief in mind. Comedy fantasy based on the children's book by Dr Seuss, starring Mike Myers, Alec Baldwin, Dakota Fanning and Spencer Breslin.

programme.title: Johnny English (2003)
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.

programme.title: Aliens Stole My Body (2020)
programme.desc: Galactic Patrol member Deputy Rod Allbright's body is stolen by B'KR, the most fiendish villain in the galaxy. Stranded on a mysterious planet, the young heroes embark on a mission to find the only being who can get it back - Rod's dad Art Allbright. Family comedy, starring Ty Consiglio, Jayden Greig and Lauren McNamara.

programme.title: Molly Moon and the Incredible Book of Hypnotism (2015)
programme.desc: An orphan faces off against a bank robber who wants a book on the art of hypnotism that she stole from her school library. Fantasy adventure, starring Raffey Cassidy, Dominic Monaghan, Lesley Manville, Emily Watson and Joan Collins.

programme.title: Dolittle (2020)
programme.desc: In Victorian era Britain, Dr John Dolittle is a Welsh vet with the ability to communicate with animals. After his wife, Lily, dies at sea, he retreats from society and only tends to animals. However, he is eventually drawn into a mission to save the Queen's life. Fantasy adventure, starring Robert Downey Jr, Antonio Banderas and Michael Sheen, while Emma Thompson, Rami Malek and Tom Holland lend their voices to some of the creatures.

credits.actor: Tom Holland lend their voices to some of the creatures

programme.title: The Witches (2020)
programme.desc: In 1967, an orphaned boy goes to live with his grandmother, only to find himself the prey of diabolical witches disguised as glamorous women. Heading to a seaside hotel seems like a great way to escape, but in an unfortunate twist of fate, the world's Grand High Witch is gathering her coven at the same resort, and has a nefarious plan in store. Co-writer/director Robert Zemeckis's take on the beloved Roald Dahl fantasy, starring Anne Hathaway, Octavia Spencer, Stanley Tucci, and narrated by Chris Rock.

programme.title: Aliens Stole My Body (2020)
programme.desc: Galactic Patrol member Deputy Rod Allbright's body is stolen by B'KR, the most fiendish villain in the galaxy. Stranded on a mysterious planet, the young heroes embark on a mission to find the only being who can get it back - Rod's dad Art Allbright. Family comedy, starring Ty Consiglio, Jayden Greig and Lauren McNamara.

programme.title: Johnny English Reborn (2011)
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent retires to a Tibetan monastery in disgrace after a mission goes wrong. He is lured out of seclusion by the chance to redeem himself when his former bosses seek his help in foiling an attempt to assassinate the premier of China. Spy comedy sequel, starring Rowan Atkinson, Gillian Anderson, Rosamund Pike and Dominic West.

programme.title: The Borrowers (1997)
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owner's son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Children's fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton.

programme.title: The Runaways (2019)
programme.desc: After their home life is turned upside down, three children and the family's donkeys escape across the backbone of northern England, confronting both the harsh landscapes and what it means to be siblings. Drama, starring Mark Addy, Tara Fitzgerald and Molly Windsor.

programme.title: The Runaways (2019)
programme.desc: After their home life is turned upside down, three children and the family's donkeys escape across the backbone of northern England, confronting both the harsh landscapes and what it means to be siblings. Drama, starring Mark Addy, Tara Fitzgerald and Molly Windsor.

programme.title: Fairytale: A True Story (1997)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about two girls whose claims to have photographed fairies in their garden in 1917 captured the imagination of the world. Controversy surrounding the pictures' authenticity raged for decades, with such famous figures as Arthur Conan Doyle and Harry Houdini taking part in the debate. Starring Florence Hoath, Elizabeth Earl, Peter O'Toole, Paul McGann and Harvey Keitel.

programme.title: Millions (2004)
programme.desc: A bag of stolen money falls from the sky, and wide-eyed youngster Damian thinks it is a gift from God. However, his level-headed brother realises they must race against time to spend the loot before the country switches to the Euro and a robber on their tail catches up with them. Comedy drama, starring Alex Etel, Lewis McGibbon, Daisy Donovan and James Nesbitt.

programme.title: Ender's Game (2013)
programme.desc: In the future, the human race has survived conflict with an alien race, but the prospect of war breaking out again is a constant threat. A gifted boy is selected as a potential military commander for the coming conflict, and subjected to a gruelling training program to prove his worth. Sci-fi adventure based on Orson Scott Card's novel, starring Asa Butterfield, Harrison Ford and Ben Kingsley.

programme.title: Short Circuit 2 (1988)
programme.desc: Manic mechanoid Johnny Five meets an old friend in New York City and embarks on a fact-finding tour - but ends up entangled in a series of escapades culminating in a bank robbery. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Fisher Stevens, Michael McKean, Cynthia Gibb and Jack Weston, with the voice of Tim Blaney.

programme.title: Fairytale: A True Story (1997)

Controversy surrounding the pictures' authenticity raged for decades, with such famous figures as Arthur Conan Doyle and Harry Houdini taking part in the debate. Starring Florence Hoath, Elizabeth Earl, Peter O'Toole, Paul McGann and Harvey Keitel.

programme.title: Monte Carlo (2011)
programme.desc: An American teenager takes a disastrous trip around Europe with her best friend and stepsister. While in a Paris hotel, she is mistaken for a British heiress and whisked off to Monte Carlo to appear at a charity event. As all three enjoy holiday romances, a jewel theft threatens to bring the deception to light. Comedy, starring Selena Gomez, Katie Cassidy and Leighton Meester.

programme.title: Ender's Game (2013)
programme.desc: In the future, the human race has survived conflict with an alien race, but the prospect of war breaking out again is a constant threat. Comedy drama, starring Alex Etel, Lewis McGibbon, Daisy Donovan and James Nesbitt.

programme.title: The Big Wish (2019)
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old orphan Salma and her two foster brothers discover a special book that is filled with stories. They set off on an adventure to find the missing links to her family's heritage, in the hope of finally getting to meet Salma's long-lost parents. Animation, with the voices of Fernanda Castillo, Dino Andrade and Alan Estrada.

Animation, with the voices of Fernanda Castillo, Dino Andrade and Alan Estrada.

programme.title: Breakthrough (2019)
programme.desc: When her adopted 14-year-old son falls through the ice on a frozen lake in Missouri, Joyce Smith refuses to give up as she stays by his bedside and prays for him to come back from the brink of death and be healed. Her steadfast belief inspires those around her to continue to pray for John's recovery, even in the face of every case history and scientific prediction. Fact-based drama, starring Chrissy Metz, Josh Lucas and Topher Grace.

programme.title: Breakthrough (2019)
programme.desc: When her adopted 14-year-old son falls through the ice on a frozen lake in Missouri, Joyce Smith refuses to give up as she stays by his bedside and prays for him to come back from the brink of death and be healed. Her steadfast belief inspires those around her to continue to pray for John's recovery, even in the face of every case history and scientific prediction. Fact-based drama, starring Chrissy Metz, Josh Lucas and Topher Grace.

programme.title: Peter Pan (2003)
programme.desc: The adventures of the boy who never grows old, as he whisks Wendy Darling and her brothers away to the magical world of Neverland - where they come face to face with fearsome Captain Hook. Adaptation of JM Barrie's fantasy novel, starring Jeremy Sumpter, Rachel Hurd-Wood, Jason Isaacs and Lynn Redgrave.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial (1982)
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends an alien who has been left stranded on Earth. The two develop a psychic connection as the boy helps the extraterrestrial to contact his own people and call for rescue. However, living on Earth starts to have a devastating effect on the visitor's health, and a government operative is determined to capture him for study. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi fantasy, starring Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Dee Wallace and Peter Coyote.

programme.title: Thunderpants (2002)
programme.desc: A 10-year-old boy blessed with an extra stomach and the ability to break wind extremely forcefully finds his talent gets him into all manner of trouble. His friend, who luckily lacks a sense of smell, invents a pair of special pants that help the flatulent youngster achieve his dream of becoming an astronaut. Family comedy, with Bruce Cook, Rupert Grint, Simon Callow, Stephen Fry and Celia Imrie.

programme.title: Little Manhattan (2005)
programme.desc: An 11-year-old New York boy encounters a girl at his karate class and falls in love. As the determined youngster does all he can to win her over, he comes to realise that affairs of the heart are seldom straightforward - particularly as his parents begin divorce proceedings. Romantic drama, starring Josh Hutcherson and Charlie Ray.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. programme.desc: A Hispanic family find hope in their extraordinary son named Sailboat when a personal gesture awakens a global desire. Armed with a 'little guitar', Sailboat leads an offbeat cast into the miraculous story of the greatest secret never told. Family drama, starring JK Simmons, Jake Busey and Noel Gugliemi.

programme.title: The Adventure Of A.R.I.: My Robot Friend (2020)
programme.desc: After repairing a broken robot, a teenager must help his new friend escape the clutches of a ruthless corporation who wants to turn the machine into a weapon. Director Stephen Shimek's family adventure, starring Jude Manley, Sophia Alongi and Greg Lutz.

programme.title: A Boy Called Sailboat (2018)
programme.desc: A Hispanic family find hope in their extraordinary son named Sailboat when a personal gesture awakens a global desire. Armed with a 'little guitar', Sailboat leads an offbeat cast into the miraculous story of the greatest secret never told. Family drama, starring JK Simmons, Jake Busey and Noel Gugliemi.

programme.title: Robo-Dog (2015)
programme.desc: A youngster is devastated when his dog dies, so his inventor father comes up with a plan to replace the lost pet. He creates a talking canine robot, with all manner of useful gadgets built into his body. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Michael Campion and Olivia d'Abo, with the voice of James Arnold Taylor.

programme.title: Robo-Dog (2015)

credits.actor: the voice of James Arnold Taylor

programme.title: The Dark Crystal (1982)
programme.desc: A survivor of a near-extinct race is given a dangerous quest as his world approaches an astronomical event that will decide its future. He must find a way to restore a broken piece to a magical crystal, which has become a source of dark power for the cruel creatures who wiped out his people. Jim Henson's puppet fantasy, with the voices of Stephen Garlick and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: Dino Dana - The Movie (2020)
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Dana Jain, who sees dinosaurs in the real world, embarks on an experiment that asks where all the kid dinosaurs are. To find the answer, Dana, older sister Saara and their new neighbors Mateo and Jadiel go on a dinosaur journey bigger than anything Dana has ever faced before. Family adventure, starring Michela Luci.

programme.title: Call of the Wild (2009)
programme.desc: A girl staying with her grandfather in the mountains finds an injured wolf dog, and nurses it back to health. She hopes to train the animal to become a sled dog, but her grandfather tries to persuade her that it belongs in the wild. Family adventure, starring Christopher Lloyd, Ariel Grade and Timothy Bottoms.

programme.title: Two Brothers (2004)
programme.desc: Two tiger cubs are plucked from the wild by the hunter who shot their father. The pair are separated and experience very different lives in proximity to people - one ends up being cruelly treated in a circus, while the other is adopted by a government official as a pet for his son. Adventure set in French Indochina in the 1920s, starring Guy Pearce, Jean-Claude Dreyfus and Freddie Highmore.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal (1982)

programme.title: My Friend The Dolphin (2019)
programme.desc: A year after befriending a couple of kids in Florida, Bernie, a lovable dolphin returns and his young friends are thrilled. However, their old enemy Winston Mills has been released from prison and he's out for revenge. Can they save the day again? Director Kirk Harris's family adventure, starring Lola Sultan, Patrick Muldoon and Logan Allen.

programme.title: Magical Adventures in the Forbidden City (2019)
programme.desc: Abigail lives in a city whose borders were closed years ago because of a mysterious disease. Going against the authorities' wishes to find her father, Abby discovers she has extraordinary magical abilities. Director Aleksandr Boguslavskiy's steampunk fantasy adventure, starring Tinatin Dalakishvili, Eddie Marsan and Rinal Mukhametov.

programme.title: The Wind That Shakes the Barley (2006)
programme.desc: An ambitious Irish graduate is given a job in London, but the actions of the British Army cause him to reconsider the move. Deciding to put his principles before his career, he joins his brother in the Republican movement, but as the political landscape shifts the siblings discover their ideas of freedom are quite different. Ken Loach's historical drama, set in Ireland in the 1920s, with Cillian Murphy and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: To Olivia (2021)
programme.desc: In 1962, writer Roald Dahl and his movie star wife Patricia Neal have retreated to the English countryside to bring up their young family. Tragically, their lives are turned upside down by the death of their daughter, Olivia. As the couple struggle through the loss, their grief becomes a source of redemption and strength which changes their destiny. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Keeley Hawes and in one of his final films, Geoffrey Palmer.

credits.actor: in one of his final films

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: Endless (2020)
programme.desc: When madly-in-love high-school graduates Riley and Chris are separated by a tragic car accident, Riley blames herself for her boyfriend's death while Chris is stranded in limbo. Miraculously, however, the two find a way to connect. Director Scott Speer's drama, starring Alexandra Shipp and Nicholas Hamilton.

programme.title: Under the Stadium Lights (2020)
programme.desc: The inspirational true story of a small-town high-school football team who beat all the odds to win their state championship. After a crushing defeat ended their previous season, everyone counted the Abilene Eagles out of title contention. Facing doubts and personal challenges both on and off the field, it takes the guidance of their team chaplain and a surrogate father figure for them to realise what they can achieve when they stand united as a team. Drama, starring Milo Gibson and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven (2005)
programme.desc: Balian, a French blacksmith in exile from his homeland, joins a crusade to Jerusalem, where he becomes a knight and pledges to defend the city and its people. Under the rule of the progressive King Baldwin, a fragile peace between Christians and Muslims has been established in the Holy City. However, the king is crippled by leprosy, and his days are numbered. His imminent death is expected to bring with it a resugence in conflict between the rival religious factions, and it is left to Balian to try to avert the seemingly inevitable war. Ridley Scott's historical epic, starring Orlando Bloom, Eva Green, Liam Neeson and Edward Norton.

programme.title: True Grit (2010)
programme.desc: A farmer is murdered by a hired hand, who flees into the wilderness. The dead man's strong-willed 14-year-old daughter is determined to bring the killer to justice, and recruits the aid of a hard-drinking, one-eyed marshal to help her track him down. The Coen brothers' Western based on Charles Portis' novel, with Jeff Bridges, Hailee Steinfeld, Matt Damon and Josh Brolin.

programme.title: The Mustang (2019)
programme.desc: Roman Coleman, a violent inmate at a maximum-security prison in Nevada, is given the chance to participate in a rehabilitation therapy programme involving the training of wild mustangs. Director Laure de Clermont-Tonnerre's drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Jason Mitchell and Bruce Dern.

programme.title: Endless (2020)
programme.desc: When madly-in-love high-school graduates Riley and Chris are separated by a tragic car accident, Riley blames herself for her boyfriend's death while Chris is stranded in limbo. programme.title: Creation Stories (2021)
programme.desc: The story of Creation Records co-founder Alan McGee, who managed and championed acts including Oasis, Primal Scream, the Jesus and Mary Chain and the Libertines. Director Nick Moran's biopic stars Ewen Bremner as McGee, alongside Kirsty Mitchell, Thomas Turgoose, Suki Waterhouse and Leo Flanagan.

credits.director: Nick Moran's biopic stars Ewen Bremner as McGee

programme.title: Gandhi (1982)
programme.desc: Richard Attenborough's Oscar-winning biopic of Mohandas K Gandhi, who rose from unlikely beginnings as a small-time lawyer to become the inspirational leader of India's struggle for independence and a worldwide ambassador for peace thanks to his philosophy of non-violent protest. Starring Ben Kingsley, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Candice Bergen, Martin Sheen, Richard Griffiths, Saeed Jaffrey, Om Puri and Geraldine James, with Daniel Day-Lewis in an early role.

programme.title: Corpus Christi (2019)
programme.desc: When a 20-year-old criminal experiences a spiritual transformation after his release from prison, he decides to minister a small-town parish, which also offers an opportunity for the local community to begin the healing process after a tragedy that happened there. Drama, starring Bartosz Bielenia, Aleksandra Konieczna and Eliza Rycembel. In Polish.

programme.title: The Glorias (2020)
programme.desc: The story of feminist icon Gloria Steinem's itinerant childhood and its influence on her life as a writer, activist and organiser for women's rights worldwide. Director Julie Taymor's biopic, starring Julianne Moore, Alicia Vikander, Ryan Kiera Armstrong and Lulu Wilson, who all portray Steinem at different points in her life. With Janelle Monae and Bette Midler.

programme.title: Monster's Ball (2001)
programme.desc: A widowed black waitress forms an intense relationship with a racist white prison guard after a series of tragedies brings them together, unaware he is the former death row prison guard who escorted her husband to the electric chair. Drama, for which Halle Berry scooped a Best Actress Oscar, also starring Billy Bob Thornton, Peter Boyle, Sean Combs and Heath Ledger.

programme.title: The Founder (2016)
programme.desc: Salesman Ray Kroc attempts to turn two brothers' innovative fast food eatery into the biggest restaurant business in the world. Drama, starring Michael Keaton, Nick Offerman and John Carroll Lynch.

programme.title: The Wrestler (2008)
programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. When a heart attack forces him to bring his already flagging career to an end, he struggles to make a life for himself, trying to reconnect with his estranged daughter and forming a relationship with a stripper. Darren Aronofsky's drama, starring Mickey Rourke and Marisa Tomei.

programme.title: Monster's Ball (2001)
programme.desc: A widowed black waitress forms an intense relationship with a racist white prison guard after a series of tragedies brings them together, unaware he is the former death row prison guard who escorted her husband to the electric chair. Drama, for which Halle Berry scooped a Best Actress Oscar, also starring Billy Bob Thornton, Peter Boyle, Sean Combs and Heath Ledger.

programme.title: The Founder (2016)
programme.desc: Salesman Ray Kroc attempts to turn two brothers' innovative fast food eatery into the biggest restaurant business in the world. Drama, starring Michael Keaton, Nick Offerman and John Carroll Lynch.

programme.title: Honeytrap (2014)
programme.desc: A Brixton teenager's misguided attempts to attract the attention of a heartless wannabe rapper have terrible results. Drama, starring Jessica Sula, Lucien Laviscount and Ntonga Mwanza.

programme.title: The Wrestler (2008)
programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. When a heart attack forces him to bring his already flagging career to an end, he struggles to make a life for himself, trying to reconnect with his estranged daughter and forming a relationship with a stripper. Darren Aronofsky's drama, starring Mickey Rourke and Marisa Tomei.

programme.title: Salmon Fishing in the Yemen (2011)
programme.desc: A British fisheries expert is recruited by an Arab sheik, who believes the sport of salmon fishing can enrich the lives of his people - if only there were fish to catch. The scientist is soon undertaking an ambitious scheme to introduce salmon to the desert, and finds his own government have an interest in the project. Comedy drama based on Paul Torday's novel, with Ewan McGregor, Emily Blunt and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Salmon Fishing in the Yemen (2011)
programme.desc: A British fisheries expert is recruited by an Arab sheik, who believes the sport of salmon fishing can enrich the lives of his people - if only there were fish to catch. The scientist is soon undertaking an ambitious scheme to introduce salmon to the desert, and finds his own government have an interest in the project. Comedy drama based on Paul Torday's novel, with Ewan McGregor, Emily Blunt and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken (2020)
programme.desc: Drama following a day in the life of Leo and his daughter Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future. Directed by Sally Potter and starring Javier Bardem and Elle Fanning.

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken (2020)
programme.desc: Drama following a day in the life of Leo and his daughter Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future. Directed by Sally Potter and starring Javier Bardem and Elle Fanning.

Comedy drama based on Paul Torday's novel, with Ewan McGregor, Emily Blunt and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. But his insatiable greed leads to a violent conflict with a young priest who is also intent on using the people and resources of an oil-rich town for his own ends. Paul Thomas Anderson's historical drama, starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis, with Paul Dano and Dillon Freasier.

programme.title: Fanny Lye Deliver'd (2019)
programme.desc: On an isolated Shropshire farm, during Oliver Cromwell's reign, Fanny Lye, a hardworking farmer's wife, learns how to transcend her oppressive marriage to a brutal Puritan ex-soldier. She also discovers a new world of possibility. Writer/Director Thomas Clay's drama, starring Maxine Peake, Charles Dance and Freddie Fox.

programme.title: The Tomorrow Man (2019)
programme.desc: Ed Hemsler spends his life preparing for a disaster that may never come. Ronnie Meisner spends hers shopping for things she may never use. When their paths cross, a romance blossoms. Writer/director Noble Jones's romantic drama, starring John Lithgow, Blythe Danner and Derek Cecil.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh.

programme.title: Seven Pounds (2008)
programme.desc: A man haunted by a tragedy he caused seeks redemption. Assuming his tax inspector brother's identity to gain access to people's private records, he sets out to atone by helping seven seemingly unconnected strangers with their problems - only to fall in love with one of the people he assists. Drama, starring Will Smith, Rosario Dawson, Woody Harrelson and Barry Pepper.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. But his insatiable greed leads to a violent conflict with a young priest who is also intent on using the people and resources of an oil-rich town for his own ends. Paul Thomas Anderson's historical drama, starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis, with Paul Dano and Dillon Freasier.

programme.title: Philadelphia (1993)
programme.desc: A gay lawyer is fired after contracting Aids, and takes his former employers to court to prove he was discriminated against because of his condition. The only attorney he can find to represent him is a homophobic courtroom rival, who is forced to confront his prejudices as the case unfolds and his client's health deteriorates. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Tom Hanks, with Denzel Washington and Antonio Banderas.

programme.title: Tolkien (2019)
programme.desc: Before going on to write classic fantasy books The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings, orphaned author JRR Tolkien finds friendship, love and artistic inspiration among a group of fellow outcasts at school. Eventually his experiences during the First World War inspire him to create a world of hobbits and wizards. Biopic, starring Nicholas Hoult, Lily Collins, Pam Ferris, Craig Roberts, and Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Little Women (2019)

programme.title: Just Mercy (2020)
programme.desc: Death row prisoner Walter McMillian, with the help of young civil rights defence attorney Bryan Stevenson, appeals his murder conviction. Director Destin Daniel Cretton's fact-based drama, starring Michael B Jordan, Jamie Foxx and Brie Larson.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Some of the films showing on Sky Cinema in June.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: The Water Diviner (2014)
programme.desc: An Australian farmer's life is shattered during the First World War, when he receives news that his three sons have been declared missing in action during the battle of Gallipoli. In the aftermath of the conflict, he travels to Turkey in the hope of discovering the truth about their fate. Period drama, directed by and starring Russell Crowe, with Olga Kurylenko.

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic of talented Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, examining her enduring relationship with husband and mentor, the womanising muralist Diego Rivera, her own scandalous affairs, and her celebrated position at the centre of the art world. Starring Salma Hayek, Valeria Golino, Mia Maestro, Roger Rees, Diego Luna and Alfred Molina.

programme.title: Palm Beach (2019)
programme.desc: A group of lifelong friends reunite for a party at Sydney's Palm Beach, during which time resentments rise to the surface, troubled relationships are revealed and secrets demand to be heard. Co-writer/director Rachel Ward's comedy drama, starring Bryan Brown, Richard E Grant and Sam Neill.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: The Water Diviner (2014)

programme.desc: Death row prisoner Walter McMillian, with the help of young civil rights defence attorney Bryan Stevenson, appeals his murder conviction. Director Destin Daniel Cretton's fact-based drama, starring Michael B Jordan, Jamie Foxx and Brie Larson.

programme.title: The Social Network (2010)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following internet billionaire Mark Zuckerberg's rise to wealth and fame. An online prank played on an ex-girlfriend gives Harvard student Zuckerberg the idea for Facebook, which soon expands away from the famous university into a worldwide phenomenon. However, in getting his project off the ground, he makes enemies of those who helped him along the way. With Jesse Eisenberg, Andrew Garfield and Justin Timberlake.

programme.title: Casualties of War (1989)
programme.desc: American soldiers on patrol during the Vietnam war abduct a local girl, but one young GI refuses to take part when they go on to rape and murder her. On their return to base, he is determined to see his comrades brought to justice. Drama, starring Michael J Fox, Sean Penn, John Leguizamo and John C Reilly.

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic of talented Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, examining her enduring relationship with husband and mentor, the womanising muralist Diego Rivera, her own scandalous affairs, and her celebrated position at the centre of the art world. Starring Salma Hayek, Valeria Golino, Mia Maestro, Roger Rees, Diego Luna and Alfred Molina.

programme.title: The Social Network (2010)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following internet billionaire Mark Zuckerberg's rise to wealth and fame. An online prank played on an ex-girlfriend gives Harvard student Zuckerberg the idea for Facebook, which soon expands away from the famous university into a worldwide phenomenon. However, in getting his project off the ground, he makes enemies of those who helped him along the way. With Jesse Eisenberg, Andrew Garfield and Justin Timberlake.

programme.title: 10 Things We Should Do Before We Break Up (2020)
programme.desc: A single mother-of-two becomes pregnant following a one-night stand with a committed bachelor, but the unlikely pair try to make a go of it. Romantic drama, starring Christina Ricci and Hamish Linklater.

programme.title: The Painted Veil (2006)
programme.desc: An English doctor's wife in 1920s China has an affair with a politician. When her husband finds out, he plots revenge by forcing her to accompany him on a mercy mission to a remote disease-ravaged village - but the hardship of their journey gives them a new perspective on their relationship. Period drama based on W Somerset Maugham's novel, starring Edward Norton, Naomi Watts, Liev Schreiber, Diana Rigg and Toby Jones.

programme.title: The Tourist (2010)
programme.desc: A fugitive's girlfriend is being watched by the police while travelling from Paris to Venice. She seduces an unsuspecting American tourist to make them think he is her lover with his appearance altered by plastic surgery, leaving the baffled holidaymaker pursued across Europe by the cops and rival gangsters. Romantic thriller, with Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie and Paul Bettany.

programme.title: Closer (2004)
programme.desc: Four individuals living in London find their lives inextricably linked over a period of years, beginning when a would-be novelist embarks on an affair with a photographer, who spurns him in favour of another man. Mike Nichols' drama, adapted from a play by Patrick Marber, starring Julia Roberts, Jude Law, Natalie Portman and Clive Owen.

programme.title: The Mustang (2019)
programme.desc: Roman Coleman, a violent inmate at a maximum-security prison in Nevada, is given the chance to participate in a rehabilitation therapy programme involving the training of wild mustangs. Director Laure de Clermont-Tonnerre's drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Jason Mitchell and Bruce Dern.

programme.title: The Painted Veil (2006)
programme.desc: An English doctor's wife in 1920s China has an affair with a politician. Period drama based on W Somerset Maugham's novel, starring Edward Norton, Naomi Watts, Liev Schreiber, Diana Rigg and Toby Jones.

Romantic thriller, with Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie and Paul Bettany.

programme.title: The Aviator (2004)
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's biopic focusing on the early years of movie producer Howard Hughes. A passion for flying dominated his life, as he embarked on increasingly ambitious aviation projects - earning powerful enemies along the way. Starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, John C Reilly, Ian Holm, Alec Baldwin, Jude Law and Cate Blanchett, who scooped an Academy Award for her performance as screen legend Katharine Hepburn.

programme.title: Corpus Christi (2019)
programme.desc: When a 20-year-old criminal experiences a spiritual transformation after his release from prison, he decides to minister a small-town parish, which also offers an opportunity for the local community to begin the healing process after a tragedy that happened there. Drama, starring Bartosz Bielenia, Aleksandra Konieczna and Eliza Rycembel. In Polish.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
programme.desc: An Indian family emigrates to a village in the South of France to open a restaurant. A bitter feud erupts with the proprietor of a restaurant just across the road, while romance blossoms between the son of the newcomers and their rival's sous chef. Comedy drama based on the novel by Richard C Morais, starring Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal and Charlotte Le Bon.

programme.title: About a Boy (2002)
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.

programme.title: About Time (2013)
programme.desc: A single man gets the chance to turn his unhappy life around when his father reveals that they both have the ability to travel through time and change their personal history. He uses his newfound talent to try to improve his love life and win the heart of an American woman he has fallen for. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: Blue Story (2019)
programme.desc: A tragic chain of events unfolds as best friends Timmy and Marco - each from different areas of London - find themselves on rival sides of a vicious postcode war. Director Andrew 'Rapman' Onwubolu's drama, starring Micheal Ward, Stephen Odubola and Eric Kofi Abrefa.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
programme.desc: An Indian family emigrates to a village in the South of France to open a restaurant. A bitter feud erupts with the proprietor of a restaurant just across the road, while romance blossoms between the son of the newcomers and their rival's sous chef. Comedy drama based on the novel by Richard C Morais, starring Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal and Charlotte Le Bon.

programme.title: Bollywood Queen (2002)
programme.desc: An Indian woman falls for a visiting Englishman, but is forced to keep the blossoming relationship a secret from her strict family. When her relatives discover she is planning to move to Britain with her new love they vow to stop her, prompting a chaotic chase across the world. Romantic musical comedy, starring Preeya Kalidas and James McAvoy.

programme.title: About a Boy (2002)
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. He uses his newfound talent to try to improve his love life and win the heart of an American woman he has fallen for. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: The Wind That Shakes the Barley (2006)
programme.desc: An ambitious Irish graduate is given a job in London, but the actions of the British Army cause him to reconsider the move. Deciding to put his principles before his career, he joins his brother in the Republican movement, but as the political landscape shifts the siblings discover their ideas of freedom are quite different. Ken Loach's historical drama, set in Ireland in the 1920s, with Cillian Murphy and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: To Olivia (2021)
programme.desc: In 1962, writer Roald Dahl and his movie star wife Patricia Neal have retreated to the English countryside to bring up their young family. Tragically, their lives are turned upside down by the death of their daughter, Olivia. As the couple struggle through the loss, their grief becomes a source of redemption and strength which changes their destiny. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Keeley Hawes and in one of his final films, Geoffrey Palmer.

Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: Endless (2020)
programme.desc: When madly-in-love high-school graduates Riley and Chris are separated by a tragic car accident, Riley blames herself for her boyfriend's death while Chris is stranded in limbo. Miraculously, however, the two find a way to connect. Director Scott Speer's drama, starring Alexandra Shipp and Nicholas Hamilton.

programme.title: Under the Stadium Lights (2020)
programme.desc: The inspirational true story of a small-town high-school football team who beat all the odds to win their state championship. After a crushing defeat ended their previous season, everyone counted the Abilene Eagles out of title contention. Facing doubts and personal challenges both on and off the field, it takes the guidance of their team chaplain and a surrogate father figure for them to realise what they can achieve when they stand united as a team. Drama, starring Milo Gibson and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven (2005)
programme.desc: Balian, a French blacksmith in exile from his homeland, joins a crusade to Jerusalem, where he becomes a knight and pledges to defend the city and its people. Under the rule of the progressive King Baldwin, a fragile peace between Christians and Muslims has been established in the Holy City. However, the king is crippled by leprosy, and his days are numbered. His imminent death is expected to bring with it a resugence in conflict between the rival religious factions, and it is left to Balian to try to avert the seemingly inevitable war. Ridley Scott's historical epic, starring Orlando Bloom, Eva Green, Liam Neeson and Edward Norton.

programme.title: True Grit (2010)
programme.desc: A farmer is murdered by a hired hand, who flees into the wilderness. The dead man's strong-willed 14-year-old daughter is determined to bring the killer to justice, and recruits the aid of a hard-drinking, one-eyed marshal to help her track him down. The Coen brothers' Western based on Charles Portis' novel, with Jeff Bridges, Hailee Steinfeld, Matt Damon and Josh Brolin.

programme.title: The Mustang (2019)
programme.desc: Roman Coleman, a violent inmate at a maximum-security prison in Nevada, is given the chance to participate in a rehabilitation therapy programme involving the training of wild mustangs. Director Laure de Clermont-Tonnerre's drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Jason Mitchell and Bruce Dern.

programme.title: True Grit (2010)
programme.desc: A farmer is murdered by a hired hand, who flees into the wilderness. The dead man's strong-willed 14-year-old daughter is determined to bring the killer to justice, and recruits the aid of a hard-drinking, one-eyed marshal to help her track him down. The Coen brothers' Western based on Charles Portis' novel, with Jeff Bridges, Hailee Steinfeld, Matt Damon and Josh Brolin.

programme.title: Creation Stories (2021)
programme.desc: The story of Creation Records co-founder Alan McGee, who managed and championed acts including Oasis, Primal Scream, the Jesus and Mary Chain and the Libertines. Director Nick Moran's biopic stars Ewen Bremner as McGee, alongside Kirsty Mitchell, Thomas Turgoose, Suki Waterhouse and Leo Flanagan.

credits.director: Nick Moran's biopic stars Ewen Bremner as McGee

programme.title: Gandhi (1982)
programme.desc: Richard Attenborough's Oscar-winning biopic of Mohandas K Gandhi, who rose from unlikely beginnings as a small-time lawyer to become the inspirational leader of India's struggle for independence and a worldwide ambassador for peace thanks to his philosophy of non-violent protest. Starring Ben Kingsley, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Candice Bergen, Martin Sheen, Richard Griffiths, Saeed Jaffrey, Om Puri and Geraldine James, with Daniel Day-Lewis in an early role.

programme.title: Corpus Christi (2019)

Drama, starring Bartosz Bielenia, Aleksandra Konieczna and Eliza Rycembel. In Polish.

programme.title: The Glorias (2020)
programme.desc: The story of feminist icon Gloria Steinem's itinerant childhood and its influence on her life as a writer, activist and organiser for women's rights worldwide. Director Julie Taymor's biopic, starring Julianne Moore, Alicia Vikander, Ryan Kiera Armstrong and Lulu Wilson, who all portray Steinem at different points in her life. With Janelle Monae and Bette Midler.

programme.title: Monster's Ball (2001)
programme.desc: A widowed black waitress forms an intense relationship with a racist white prison guard after a series of tragedies brings them together, unaware he is the former death row prison guard who escorted her husband to the electric chair. Drama, for which Halle Berry scooped a Best Actress Oscar, also starring Billy Bob Thornton, Peter Boyle, Sean Combs and Heath Ledger.

programme.title: The Wrestler (2008)
programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. When a heart attack forces him to bring his already flagging career to an end, he struggles to make a life for himself, trying to reconnect with his estranged daughter and forming a relationship with a stripper. Darren Aronofsky's drama, starring Mickey Rourke and Marisa Tomei.

programme.title: Honeytrap (2014)
programme.desc: A Brixton teenager's misguided attempts to attract the attention of a heartless wannabe rapper have terrible results. Drama, starring Jessica Sula, Lucien Laviscount and Ntonga Mwanza.

programme.title: The Wrestler (2008)
programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. When a heart attack forces him to bring his already flagging career to an end, he struggles to make a life for himself, trying to reconnect with his estranged daughter and forming a relationship with a stripper. Darren Aronofsky's drama, starring Mickey Rourke and Marisa Tomei.

programme.title: Salmon Fishing in the Yemen (2011)
programme.desc: A British fisheries expert is recruited by an Arab sheik, who believes the sport of salmon fishing can enrich the lives of his people - if only there were fish to catch. The scientist is soon undertaking an ambitious scheme to introduce salmon to the desert, and finds his own government have an interest in the project. Comedy drama based on Paul Torday's novel, with Ewan McGregor, Emily Blunt and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Salmon Fishing in the Yemen (2011)
programme.desc: A British fisheries expert is recruited by an Arab sheik, who believes the sport of salmon fishing can enrich the lives of his people - if only there were fish to catch. The scientist is soon undertaking an ambitious scheme to introduce salmon to the desert, and finds his own government have an interest in the project. Comedy drama based on Paul Torday's novel, with Ewan McGregor, Emily Blunt and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken (2020)
programme.desc: Drama following a day in the life of Leo and his daughter Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future. Directed by Sally Potter and starring Javier Bardem and Elle Fanning.

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. But his insatiable greed leads to a violent conflict with a young priest who is also intent on using the people and resources of an oil-rich town for his own ends. Paul Thomas Anderson's historical drama, starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis, with Paul Dano and Dillon Freasier.

programme.title: Fanny Lye Deliver'd (2019)
programme.desc: On an isolated Shropshire farm, during Oliver Cromwell's reign, Fanny Lye, a hardworking farmer's wife, learns how to transcend her oppressive marriage to a brutal Puritan ex-soldier. She also discovers a new world of possibility. Writer/Director Thomas Clay's drama, starring Maxine Peake, Charles Dance and Freddie Fox.

programme.title: The Tomorrow Man (2019)
programme.desc: Ed Hemsler spends his life preparing for a disaster that may never come. Ronnie Meisner spends hers shopping for things she may never use. When their paths cross, a romance blossoms. Writer/director Noble Jones's romantic drama, starring John Lithgow, Blythe Danner and Derek Cecil.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Finding Neverland (2004)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh.

programme.title: Seven Pounds (2008)
programme.desc: A man haunted by a tragedy he caused seeks redemption. Assuming his tax inspector brother's identity to gain access to people's private records, he sets out to atone by helping seven seemingly unconnected strangers with their problems - only to fall in love with one of the people he assists. Drama, starring Will Smith, Rosario Dawson, Woody Harrelson and Barry Pepper.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. But his insatiable greed leads to a violent conflict with a young priest who is also intent on using the people and resources of an oil-rich town for his own ends. Paul Thomas Anderson's historical drama, starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis, with Paul Dano and Dillon Freasier.

programme.title: Philadelphia (1993)
programme.desc: A gay lawyer is fired after contracting Aids, and takes his former employers to court to prove he was discriminated against because of his condition. The only attorney he can find to represent him is a homophobic courtroom rival, who is forced to confront his prejudices as the case unfolds and his client's health deteriorates. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Tom Hanks, with Denzel Washington and Antonio Banderas.

programme.title: Tolkien (2019)
programme.desc: Before going on to write classic fantasy books The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings, orphaned author JRR Tolkien finds friendship, love and artistic inspiration among a group of fellow outcasts at school. Eventually his experiences during the First World War inspire him to create a world of hobbits and wizards. Biopic, starring Nicholas Hoult, Lily Collins, Pam Ferris, Craig Roberts, and Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. programme.desc: Death row prisoner Walter McMillian, with the help of young civil rights defence attorney Bryan Stevenson, appeals his murder conviction. Director Destin Daniel Cretton's fact-based drama, starring Michael B Jordan, Jamie Foxx and Brie Larson.
