programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Some of the films showing on Sky Cinema in June.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: The Water Diviner (2014)
programme.desc: An Australian farmer's life is shattered during the First World War, when he receives news that his three sons have been declared missing in action during the battle of Gallipoli. In the aftermath of the conflict, he travels to Turkey in the hope of discovering the truth about their fate. Period drama, directed by and starring Russell Crowe, with Olga Kurylenko.

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic of talented Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, examining her enduring relationship with husband and mentor, the womanising muralist Diego Rivera, her own scandalous affairs, and her celebrated position at the centre of the art world. Starring Salma Hayek, Valeria Golino, Mia Maestro, Roger Rees, Diego Luna and Alfred Molina.

programme.title: Palm Beach (2019)
programme.desc: A group of lifelong friends reunite for a party at Sydney's Palm Beach, during which time resentments rise to the surface, troubled relationships are revealed and secrets demand to be heard. Co-writer/director Rachel Ward's comedy drama, starring Bryan Brown, Richard E Grant and Sam Neill.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. programme.title: The Social Network (2010)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following internet billionaire Mark Zuckerberg's rise to wealth and fame. An online prank played on an ex-girlfriend gives Harvard student Zuckerberg the idea for Facebook, which soon expands away from the famous university into a worldwide phenomenon. However, in getting his project off the ground, he makes enemies of those who helped him along the way. With Jesse Eisenberg, Andrew Garfield and Justin Timberlake.

programme.title: Casualties of War (1989)
programme.desc: American soldiers on patrol during the Vietnam war abduct a local girl, but one young GI refuses to take part when they go on to rape and murder her. On their return to base, he is determined to see his comrades brought to justice. Drama, starring Michael J Fox, Sean Penn, John Leguizamo and John C Reilly.

programme.title: Frida (2002)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic of talented Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, examining her enduring relationship with husband and mentor, the womanising muralist Diego Rivera, her own scandalous affairs, and her celebrated position at the centre of the art world. Starring Salma Hayek, Valeria Golino, Mia Maestro, Roger Rees, Diego Luna and Alfred Molina.

programme.title: 10 Things We Should Do Before We Break Up (2020)
programme.desc: A single mother-of-two becomes pregnant following a one-night stand with a committed bachelor, but the unlikely pair try to make a go of it. Romantic drama, starring Christina Ricci and Hamish Linklater.

programme.title: The Painted Veil (2006)
programme.desc: An English doctor's wife in 1920s China has an affair with a politician. When her husband finds out, he plots revenge by forcing her to accompany him on a mercy mission to a remote disease-ravaged village - but the hardship of their journey gives them a new perspective on their relationship. Period drama based on W Somerset Maugham's novel, starring Edward Norton, Naomi Watts, Liev Schreiber, Diana Rigg and Toby Jones.

programme.title: The Tourist (2010)
programme.desc: A fugitive's girlfriend is being watched by the police while travelling from Paris to Venice. She seduces an unsuspecting American tourist to make them think he is her lover with his appearance altered by plastic surgery, leaving the baffled holidaymaker pursued across Europe by the cops and rival gangsters. Romantic thriller, with Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie and Paul Bettany.

programme.title: Closer (2004)
programme.desc: Four individuals living in London find their lives inextricably linked over a period of years, beginning when a would-be novelist embarks on an affair with a photographer, who spurns him in favour of another man. Mike Nichols' drama, adapted from a play by Patrick Marber, starring Julia Roberts, Jude Law, Natalie Portman and Clive Owen.

programme.title: The Mustang (2019)
programme.desc: Roman Coleman, a violent inmate at a maximum-security prison in Nevada, is given the chance to participate in a rehabilitation therapy programme involving the training of wild mustangs. Director Laure de Clermont-Tonnerre's drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Jason Mitchell and Bruce Dern.

programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's biopic focusing on the early years of movie producer Howard Hughes. A passion for flying dominated his life, as he embarked on increasingly ambitious aviation projects - earning powerful enemies along the way. Starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, John C Reilly, Ian Holm, Alec Baldwin, Jude Law and Cate Blanchett, who scooped an Academy Award for her performance as screen legend Katharine Hepburn.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
programme.desc: An Indian family emigrates to a village in the South of France to open a restaurant. A bitter feud erupts with the proprietor of a restaurant just across the road, while romance blossoms between the son of the newcomers and their rival's sous chef. Comedy drama based on the novel by Richard C Morais, starring Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal and Charlotte Le Bon.

programme.title: About a Boy (2002)
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.

programme.title: About Time (2013)
programme.desc: A single man gets the chance to turn his unhappy life around when his father reveals that they both have the ability to travel through time and change their personal history. He uses his newfound talent to try to improve his love life and win the heart of an American woman he has fallen for. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: Blue Story (2019)
programme.desc: A tragic chain of events unfolds as best friends Timmy and Marco - each from different areas of London - find themselves on rival sides of a vicious postcode war. Director Andrew 'Rapman' Onwubolu's drama, starring Micheal Ward, Stephen Odubola and Eric Kofi Abrefa.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
programme.desc: An Indian family emigrates to a village in the South of France to open a restaurant. Comedy drama based on the novel by Richard C Morais, starring Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal and Charlotte Le Bon.

programme.title: Bollywood Queen (2002)
programme.desc: An Indian woman falls for a visiting Englishman, but is forced to keep the blossoming relationship a secret from her strict family. When her relatives discover she is planning to move to Britain with her new love they vow to stop her, prompting a chaotic chase across the world. Romantic musical comedy, starring Preeya Kalidas and James McAvoy.

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Due to the shortage of surgeons, Jo tries to convince Bailey to let her switch specialities. Link accuses Amelia of overstepping the mark while he is treating a patient remotely and Winston comes up with an out-of-the-box idea.

programme.title: Station 19
programme.desc: The Black Firefighters' Coalition banquet takes a dramatic turn when Chief Gregory falls ill, prompting Ben and Dean to try to save his life - only to endanger their own.

programme.title: Duck Quacks Don't Echo
programme.sub-title: Claudia Winkleman, Johnny Vegas, Joe Lycett

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Transgender Kids
programme.desc: Louis travels to San Francisco, where pioneering medical professionals are helping children who say they were born in the wrong body to transition from one sex to the other. At the Child and Adolescent Gender Centre at UCSF Hospital, he meets youngsters who have been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and who are undergoing medical interventions, from puberty blockers to hormone-replacement therapy and ultimately gender-reassignment surgery. Louis spends time with the clinic's patients and their families as they negotiate their way along this life-changing and emotional journey.

programme.title: Olly Alexander: Growing Up Gay
programme.desc: The Years & Years lead singer explores why members of the LGBT+ community are more vulnerable to mental health issues, as he opens up about his own long-term battle with depression. Olly joins young people on their own personal journeys as they battle issues that parallel his own, from homophobic bullying to eating and anxiety disorders, and questions what can be done to address them.

programme.title: Emily Atack: Adulting
programme.desc: Emily embarks on a mission to discover whether finding love could be the answer to all her problems, and meets a dating expert to address her concerns before going on a blind date.

programme.desc: A woman fights for her life after being knifed by her former partner, while a teenager on her way to seeing two Youtube stars in a live appearance is felled by a falling tree.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Doctor and Amy face a terrifying trek through the Maze of the Dead after being asked to track down the last of the Weeping Angels following the crash of a space ship into a ruined temple. The mission reintroduces the Time Lord to the mysterious River Song (Alex Kingston reprising her role), and he has to work out if he can trust her. Guest starring Iain Glen (Game of Thrones) with Matt Smith and Karen Gillan, and featuring a cameo by Mike Skinner of the Streets.

credits.actor: featuring a cameo by Mike Skinner of the Streets

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Time Lord is trapped by an army of Weeping Angels, and his only chance of escape is to climb through the wreckage of the space liner that crashed into the temple. In the forest vault, Amy faces an even more deadly attack. Matt Smith and Karen Gillan are again joined by Alex Kingston as River Song.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The time travellers head off to 16th-century Venice, where not only is the city sealed off to protect residents from the plague, but they are also trapped with a coven of beautiful vampires. As the Doctor tries to deal with the threat, he crosses swords with Rosanna, the scheming head of the House of Calvierri. Helen McCrory (Narcissa Malfoy in the Harry Potter films) guest stars alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Five years in the future, Amy has put her adventures with the Doctor behind her and is about to become a mother. The Time Lord returns and leaves her facing a heart-breaking choice that will change her life for ever. Toby Jones (Truman Capote in Infamous) guest stars alongside Karen Gillan and Matt Smith, in an episode written by Men Behaving Badly creator Simon Nye.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. When an ambitious project to drill into the Earth wakens an ancient enemy, the Doctor leaps into action. As Amy learns she cannot trust even the ground under her feet, it becomes clear that while humans were digging down, another species was on its way up. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Ben takes his talent for lying to a new level, while Pete finds himself being questioned about his SAS training and friendship with then prime minister Gordon Brown. Meanwhile, Sue arranges a romantic night at home, but her plans could be scuppered if Karen's friend and her mother are still hanging around.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Pete worries he might be out of a job when he finds his troubles splashed across the front page of the local paper. Ben claims he is too ill to go to school, but manages a telling question-and-answer session. The family also has to cheer up Auntie Angela when she is dumped by her boyfriend.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Karen has had enough of her mother's nagging and packs her bags, as preparations get under way for the family dinner party. Ben is put in charge of cracking the eggs - a responsibility his dad later regrets giving him - and the boy develops a taste for gin when the guests arrive. Angela announces she is moving back to Australia.

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: Penny threatens to cancel the shop owner's Christmas if she can't manage to get her life in order. With Stevie having secured herself new employment, Miranda decides to follow suit and get a job in an office - but it proves easier said than done. Meanwhile, her romantic situation is just as messy as her professional life. Can she and Gary remain just good friends? Miranda Hart, Patricia Hodge and Tom Ellis star.

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: Gary decides to join the dating scene so he can bring someone along to Stevie's birthday party, prompting Miranda to do the same. Are the two of them destined to find romance in the arms of strangers - or with each other? Meanwhile, the shop owner can't hide her embarrassment when Penny decides to run for local councillor. Comedy, starring Miranda Hart, Tom Ellis and Patricia Hodge.

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: The shop owner's friends accuse her of being immature, so she sets out to prove she can officially be an adult. Comedy, starring Miranda Hart, Tom Ellis and Patricia Hodge.

programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores the changing face of US culture, beginning with a look at a movement in Portland, Oregon, that seeks to broaden how the world views marriage in a time of rising divorce rates, suggesting that monogamy is not essential and that polyamorous or open relationships can be equally fulfilling. However, while Louis meets many who have found happiness with multiple partners, he also discovers tales of heartbreak and jealousy.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part one of two. The contemplative reporter examines life in Miami County Jail, where most of the inmates are awaiting trial. The inmates' lives are governed by a gladiatorial code, leading to fights for food and status - a situation the guards say they are powerless to address.

programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores the changing face of US culture, beginning with a look at a movement in Portland, Oregon, that seeks to broaden how the world views marriage in a time of rising divorce rates, suggesting that monogamy is not essential and that polyamorous or open relationships can be equally fulfilling. However, while Louis meets many who have found happiness with multiple partners, he also discovers tales of heartbreak and jealousy.

programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary focuses on everyday situations in the neonatal ward, which treats one in 10 of the babies born at the maternity hospital. Parents anxiously await news of their twins, who were born 17 weeks premature, and a couple remain positive that one of their newborn triplets will soon be able to join his two brothers at home.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Transgender Kids
programme.desc: Louis travels to San Francisco, where pioneering medical professionals are helping children who say they were born in the wrong body to transition from one sex to the other. At the Child and Adolescent Gender Centre at UCSF Hospital, he meets youngsters who have been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and who are undergoing medical interventions, from puberty blockers to hormone-replacement therapy and ultimately gender-reassignment surgery. Louis spends time with the clinic's patients and their families as they negotiate their way along this life-changing and emotional journey.

programme.title: Jamie: Drag Queen at 16

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Pete worries he might be out of a job when he finds his troubles splashed across the front page of the local paper. Ben claims he is too ill to go to school, but manages a telling question-and-answer session. The family also has to cheer up Auntie Angela when she is dumped by her boyfriend.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Karen has had enough of her mother's nagging and packs her bags, as preparations get under way for the family dinner party. Ben is put in charge of cracking the eggs - a responsibility his dad later regrets giving him - and the boy develops a taste for gin when the guests arrive. Angela announces she is moving back to Australia.

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: Penny threatens to cancel the shop owner's Christmas if she can't manage to get her life in order. With Stevie having secured herself new employment, Miranda decides to follow suit and get a job in an office - but it proves easier said than done. Meanwhile, her romantic situation is just as messy as her professional life. Can she and Gary remain just good friends? Miranda Hart, Patricia Hodge and Tom Ellis star.

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: Gary decides to join the dating scene so he can bring someone along to Stevie's birthday party, prompting Miranda to do the same. Are the two of them destined to find romance in the arms of strangers - or with each other? Meanwhile, the shop owner can't hide her embarrassment when Penny decides to run for local councillor. Comedy, starring Miranda Hart, Tom Ellis and Patricia Hodge.

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: The shop owner's friends accuse her of being immature, so she sets out to prove she can officially be an adult. programme.title: Olly Alexander: Growing Up Gay
programme.desc: The Years & Years lead singer explores why members of the LGBT+ community are more vulnerable to mental health issues, as he opens up about his own long-term battle with depression. programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Doctor and Amy face a terrifying trek through the Maze of the Dead after being asked to track down the last of the Weeping Angels following the crash of a space ship into a ruined temple. The mission reintroduces the Time Lord to the mysterious River Song (Alex Kingston reprising her role), and he has to work out if he can trust her. Guest starring Iain Glen (Game of Thrones) with Matt Smith and Karen Gillan, and featuring a cameo by Mike Skinner of the Streets.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Time Lord is trapped by an army of Weeping Angels, and his only chance of escape is to climb through the wreckage of the space liner that crashed into the temple. In the forest vault, Amy faces an even more deadly attack. Matt Smith and Karen Gillan are again joined by Alex Kingston as River Song.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The time travellers head off to 16th-century Venice, where not only is the city sealed off to protect residents from the plague, but they are also trapped with a coven of beautiful vampires. As the Doctor tries to deal with the threat, he crosses swords with Rosanna, the scheming head of the House of Calvierri. Helen McCrory (Narcissa Malfoy in the Harry Potter films) guest stars alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Five years in the future, Amy has put her adventures with the Doctor behind her and is about to become a mother. Toby Jones (Truman Capote in Infamous) guest stars alongside Karen Gillan and Matt Smith, in an episode written by Men Behaving Badly creator Simon Nye.

programme.title: Doctor Who

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy answers a call about a pensioner who has been attacked during a burglary, so Stevie and Mickey set up a sting operation that reveals a well-established outfit selling stolen goods on the Internet. When two hoodies previously seen arguing with the victim have been eliminated from the inquiry, the officers are left with some unlikely suspects, reminding them how deceptive appearances can be.

programme.desc: Sarah, who's 40, and 29-year-old Tom, await the birth of their second child together. programme.sub-title: Inside the Ambulance: Coast and Country
programme.desc: Paramedics in Oxford treat a woman suffering from a mystery illness, while in Portsmouth, the crews treat an elderly diabetic patient with dangerously low blood sugar.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part one of two. The contemplative reporter examines life in Miami County Jail, where most of the inmates are awaiting trial. He begins by exploring the large cage-like dwellings on the fifth and sixth floors, which are home to many of the most volatile prisoners. The inmates' lives are governed by a gladiatorial code, leading to fights for food and status - a situation the guards say they are powerless to address.

programme.title: The Shift: Women on the Force
programme.desc: PC Emaleigh Simeson gets a Code Zero radio call - a colleague is in immediate danger. Meanwhile, PC Alicia Oakes deals with a spitting drunk woman.

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The team treat a lorry driver trapped behind his twisted steering wheel and help is urgently required for a 12-year-old who appears to be drunk after drinking an unknown substance.

programme.desc: Sarah Baeumler's design role expands as she begins to work directly with clients. How will she fare when faced with strict budgets and high expectations from homeowners?.

programme.desc: Young couple Chynna and Spencer, who are both 21, arrive expecting their second child together, with Chynna's mother on hand to help them through the labour. Meanwhile, Seif, who fled the war in Sudan 15 years ago, and his partner Halah are desperate to start a family together, and anxiously await the arrival of their new baby after tragically losing their first child six months into the pregnancy.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.sub-title: Inside the Ambulance: Coast and Country
programme.desc: The crews attend a man who has fallen off his bike and a four-year-old struggling with tonsillitis. Plus, a 35-year-old man with chest pains proves very hard to find.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part two of two. The reporter goes deeper into the jail system, meeting an alleged triple murderer facing a possible death sentence. He also follows a group of younger convicts who have avoided prison by pleading guilty and attending a four-month military-style boot camp. Among them is a 14-year-old boy who may face a 10-year sentence for armed robbery if he cannot endure the harsh training and rehabilitation programme.

programme.title: The Shift: Women on the Force
programme.desc: PCs Emma Bainbridge and Hannah Lamb search for an injured passenger after a run-in with a drunk driver, and PC Alicia Oakes uses her Taser for the first time to defend a colleague.
